citations.desc: ATTENDING VETERINARIAN AND ADEQUATE VETERINARY CARE (DEALERS AND EXHIBITORS).
citations.narrative:
A rabbit "Duke" is thin. His ribs and spinal column can be easily felt. This rabbit was previously treated for an ear
infection back in November 2016 and has not had any additional veterinary examinations.
The ferret was also thin. The ribs and spinal column were also easily felt. The ferret was last seen by the
veterinarian back in September 2016 for routine vaccinations.
These animals shall be re-examined by your veterinarian and treated accordingly.
Correct by April 17, 2017

There is a horizontal strip of wood along one of the walls in the goat/pig enclosure which is above the water
receptacles. This strip of wood has advanced deterioration, is no longer structurally sound, and now contains many
exposed sharp points & splinters
These sharp points and splinters pose even a greater risk of injury to these animals if they should make contact
with, since it is where the animals go to drink.
The enclosure shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury.
Correct by April 21, 2017

There are two uncovered plastic cages that houses hedgehogs. These cages are directly underneath a narrow
shelf that has several ceramic figurines, a large trophy, and a soda bottle. This shelf is approximately 2 feet above
these cages.
This poses a risk of injury to the animals if an object should fall off this shelf and strike a hedgehog.
Articles that pose a risk of injury to the animals shall be removed from the animal area so as not to pose a risk of
injury.
Correct by April 15, 2017
This inspection and exit interview were conducted on-site on April 11, 2017 with the licensee.
The licensee had to leave before this inspection report could be completed. By mutual agreement, this report will
be sent by E Mail to the licensee
